p: In this review, we have summarized the recent knowledge on the biology of ERAP1 and ERAP2 enzymes and their possible links to several infectious diseases. Polymorphic variations in ERAP1 and ERAP2 genes, modifies their function and their skill to produce antigenic peptides and controls cytotoxic responses against antigen-presenting cells. The numerous studies reviewed in this manuscript definitely confirm that such variations in ERAPs expression and/or genetic variants have an important repercussion on the onset and/or progression of infectious diseases. Indeed, ERAPs function as key factors within the antigen presentation pathway, influencing the interaction between pathogens and natural host resistance.
